HOSPAZ will reach a target population of 42000 OVC and 2000 adults in FY14 through health,education,child rights and economic strengthening activities.There will be an increase of 15% in FY15 to 50600.To achieve this target linkages will be established with existing programs and at the same time more teachers and volunteers will be trained.New partners will be brought on board to cover the deficit left by graduating partners and activities will be scaled up in existing districts.Child protection mechanisms will be conducted through the DSS structures while health related interventions will be aligned to already existing health service facilities.Economic strengthening activities will be done in collaboration with relevant Ministries such as Ministry of Youth Indigenization and Empowerment,Ministry of Agriculture and Ministry of Gender and Women Empowerment.Service delivery initiatives will include block granting,direct school fees payment,school health assessments,child rights education and PSS,ISAL,family IGAs,Gender Based Violence to improve prevention and response to gender based violence,case management,improving access to ART services for children and post PMTCT mother/baby pairs through the IMPACT project and SRH activities to improve life skills and prevention of HIV. Targeting will be aligned to the national policy and at child level the selection process will focus on out-of-school youth,children with disabilities,HIV+ children,child headed households and adolescent girls.The consortium will take advantage of the village vulnerability registers to identify highly vulnerable children,while at household level a HVA will be conducted.The M&E system will emphasize on outcome and impact evaluation as well as operational research to inform evidence based programming
